Module hu.unipannon.virt.plot
Package hu.unipannon.virt.plot.fluent

Class LineStyle

  • java.lang.Object
    • hu.unipannon.virt.plot.fluent.LineStyle
  • public class LineStyle
extends java.lang.Object
    Fluent interface responsible of storing styling elements to a Line object. Provides functionallity to set the following properties in a single method chain: Style, Color, Width, Marker, Line error.
    Author:
    Tóth Bálint

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description

      • LineStyle

        public LineStyle​(java.lang.String style)
        Constructs a LineStyle instance with the given stroke style as MATLAB format string.
        Parameters:
        style - stroke style of the line as format string ("-", "-.", ":", "--").

    • Method Detail

      • style

        public static LineStyle style()
        Fluent interface starter method with empty parameter list. This function can be used to start the method chain without setting a stroke style. In this case the default line style is used.
        Returns:
        new instance of LineStyle.

      • style

        public static LineStyle style​(java.lang.String style)
        Fluent interface starter method that sets the style as MATLAB format string.
        Parameters:
        style - stroke style of the line as format string ("-", "-.", ":", "--").
        Returns:
        new instance of LineStyle.

      • style

        public static LineStyle style​(StrokeStyle style)
        Fluent interface starter method that sets the style.
        Parameters:
        style - stroke style of the line.
        Returns:
        new instance of LineStyle.

      • width

        public LineStyle width​(double width)
        Fluent interface method, sets the width of the line.
        Parameters:
        width - width of the line in points.
        Returns:
        itself.

      • color

        public LineStyle color​(javafx.scene.paint.Paint color)
        Fluent interface method, sets the color of the line.
        Parameters:
        color - color of the line as JavaFX Paint.
        Returns:
        itself.

      • color

        public LineStyle color​(java.lang.String color)
        Fluent interface method, sets the color of the line. Accepted colors: red (r), green (g), blue (b), black (k), yellow (y), cyan (c), magenta (m). Hexadecimal (web notation) form of RGB colors can also be given to this function.
        Parameters:
        color - color of the line as MATLAB color string or hex code.
        Returns:
        itself.

      • marker

        public LineStyle marker​(Marker.MarkerType markerType)
        Fluent interface method, sets the marker for the line.
        Parameters:
        markerType - marker as enumerated value (ASTERISK, CIRCLE, CROSS, DOT, PLUS, NONE).
        Returns:
        itself.

      • marker

        public LineStyle marker​(java.lang.String markerType)
        Fluent interface method, sets the marker for the line from the given MATLAB format string.
        Parameters:
        markerType - marker as string value ("*", "o", "X", ".", "+").
        Returns:
        itself.

      • error

        public LineStyle error​(double[] lower,
                       double[] upper)
        Sets the measurement error intervals for the data points.
        Parameters:
        lower - lowest value measured at the given point.
        upper - highest value measured at the given point.
        Returns:
        itself.

      • errorLines

        public LineStyle errorLines()
        Enables error lines. Use this function alongside the error() function.
        Returns:
        itself.

      • errorLines

        public LineStyle errorLines​(LineStyle style)
        Enables error lines with the given style. Use this function alongside the error() function.
        Parameters:
        style - style of the error lines.
        Returns:
        itself.

      • errorArea

        public LineStyle errorArea()
        Enables error area with the default color. Use this function alongside the error() function.
        Returns:
        itself.

        public LineStyle errorArea​(javafx.scene.paint.Paint color)
        Enables error area with the given color. Use this function alongside the error() function.
        Parameters:
        color - color of the patch on the plot.
        Returns:
        itself.
